run.summary: MCP MVP shipped: lifecycle tools + security hardening. Team investigation (architect, visionary, karen) validated MCP-first strategy with synthesis: "MCP for distribution, daemon for evolution, lifecycle for differentiation."
run.what-worked: - Three-agent investigation produced clear strategic synthesis - Lifecycle tools expose reef's differentiator (calcification stages) - Input validation caught early via Karen's security concerns - MCP server now exposes 11 tools, 3 resources
run.what-didnt: - Reef health shows "declining" due to low quality/resonance scores - Need to enrich polips with facts/decisions/links - Karen's concerns about protocol risk remain valid but accepted

decisions.decision: MCP-first but expose lifecycle tools as differentiator
Input validation mandatory before public release
Keep hooks for Claude Code, MCP for Claude Desktop
Strategy: MCP distribution → daemon evolution → platform
